Name: CarePlanActivityStatus

Descriptino: Codes that reflect the current state of a care plan activity within its overall life cycle.

Name: GoalLifecycleStatus
Title: GoalLifecycleStatus
Descriptino: Codes that reflect the current state of a goal and whether the goal is still being targeted.

Name: NarrativeStatus
Title: NarrativeStatus
Descriptino: The status of a resource narrative.

Name: ObservationStatus
Title: ObservationStatus
Descriptino: Codes providing the status of an observation.

Name: RequestIntent
Title: RequestIntent
Descriptino: Codes indicating the degree of authority/intentionality associated with a request.

Name: RequestStatus
Title: RequestStatus
Descriptino: Codes identifying the lifecycle stage of a request.

Name: ResourceType
Title: ResourceType
Descriptino: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

Name: USCoreCategory
Title: US Core Category
Descriptino: Category codes used across US Core Profiles and resource types. They are typically used when there is a need for categorization for searching and finding resources or workflow hints.

Name: LOINC
Title: Logical Observation Identifiers
Descriptino: Names and Codes (LOINC)
Used: LOINC provides a set of universal names and ID codes for identifying laboratory and clinical test results.1,2 LOINC facilitates the exchange and pooling of results, such as blood hemoglobin, serum potassium, or vital signs, for clinical care, outcomes management, and research. LOINC's universal identifiers (names and codes) can be used in the context of order and observation exchanges between information systems that use syntax standards such as HL73, CEN TC251, ISO TC215, ASTM4, and DICOM. Specifically, the identifier can be used as the coded value for an observation in any other standard that uses the observation/observation value paradigm, whether messages, documents, application programming interface (API), etc. For example, LOINC codes are used widely in the OBX segment Observation Identifier field (OBX-3) of an ORU HL7 (HL7 version 2.x or ASTM 1238-9410) message that may be sent between a Clinical Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) and Electronic Health Record Systems (EHR).5, 6 In this way, LOINC codes provide universal identifiers that allow the exchange of clinical data between heterogeneous computing environments.

Name: PCOCategoryCodesExample
Title: Category Code Examples
Descriptino: Example code system to identify the category for PCO resources.

Name: PCOGASCodesTemporary
Title: Goal Attainment Scaling (GAS) Codes
Descriptino: Temporary code system for GAS codes until publication by LOINC. All of these codes have been submitted to LOINC.

Name: WhatMattersConcepts
Title: What Matters Concepts
Descriptino: Code system to identify "What Matters" concepts, example from the VA Circle of Health.

Name: SNOMED_CT
Title: SNOMED CT (all versions)
Descriptino: SNOMED CT is the most comprehensive and precise clinical health terminology product in the world, owned and distributed around the world by The International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO).

Name: DataAbsentReason
Title: DataAbsentReason
Descriptino: Used to specify why the normally expected content of the data element is missing.

Name: GoalAchievementStatus
Title: Goal achievement status
Descriptino: Describes the progression, or lack thereof, towards the goal against the target.

Name: GoalCategory
Title: Goal category
Descriptino: Example codes for grouping goals to use for filtering or presentation.

Name: GoalPriority
Title: Goal priority
Descriptino: Indicates the level of importance associated with reaching or sustaining a goal.

Name: ObservationCategoryCodes
Title: Observation Category Codes
Descriptino: Observation Category codes.

Name: ObservationReferenceRangeMeaningCodes
Title: Observation Reference Range Meaning Codes
Descriptino: This value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the meaning/use of a reference range for a particular target population.

Name: ObservationInterpretation
Title: ObservationInterpretation
Descriptino: One or more codes providing a rough qualitative interpretation of the observation, such as "normal" / "abnormal", "low" / "high", "better" / "worse", "resistant" / "susceptible", "expected" / "not expected". The value set is intended to be for ANY use where coded representation of an interpretation is needed.

Name: Ietf3066
Title: Tags for the Identification of Languages
Descriptino: Older value from OID registry.  Superceded; see recommendations in BCP-47.
